instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: retina display image question
threads.message:
Hi all,

if oyu have a retina display  when you put a light on the backside of the display
you can see the apple logo when the machine is turned off.
if you plugin the charger
you cannot see the apple logo anymore.

is this Always like this or only when you have a backlight issue

so does this also happen when you have a no image problem?

threads.title: retina display image question
threads.message: the image will stop the light from shining through

threads.title: retina display image question
threads.message:
so that means image is there just no backlight

thanks got something to hunt

threads.title: retina display image question
threads.message: you should be able to see an image if you shine a light through. What voltage do you get on backlight?
